page.title: 05LAND USE
page.content: The soil around Kirby is London clay covered with sandy gravel soil.This type of soil is good for arable crops.In this area the farms produce wheat, barley and maize.The cows eat the maize.From the cows the farmer gets milk,and has his own dairy.The farmer does a local delivery service daily.A total of 250 cows produce about 150 gallons of milk daily. The main animals are cows,but he might have a few sheep.Some farmers also keep ducks,geese and chickens. Some farmers keep spare land for pheasants cover.
